questions.question_text: Which component does the hyperbus interface (vmk50) provide network connectivity to?

choices.D: virtual machines running in the same segment
choices.C: virtual machines running on the same hypervisor
choices.A: containers running on ESXi/KVM transport nodes
choices.B: virtual machines and containers running across transport nodes

discussion.content:
A is correct.

https://cloudbytesecurity.com/2019/11/05/prepare-host-transport-nodes/

Selected Answer: A
A is the correct answer

if you checked this KB page, you could see that a container failed due to missing vmk50
https://kb.vmware.com/s/article/67432
https://kb.vmware.com/s/article/67432?lang=en_US
The question is does KVM transport node support vmk50?

A it's correct:

https://cloudbytesecurity.com/2019/11/05/prepare-host-transport-nodes/

A second interface is created, vmk50. This vmkernel interface is the hyperbus interface. This interface is an internal loopback interface used to establish communication with host containerized workloads. Because this internal interface does not send traffic outside of the ESXi host, the network automatically configured has an APIPA IP assigned from the range, 169.254.0.0/24 subnet.

choices.A: Create a secondary vNIC on each quest VM for SVM communication.
choices.C: Centralize partner SVMs in a service cluster.
choices.B: Place a partner SVM on each compute cluster node.
choices.D: Add partner SVMs to an edge cluster.

comments.content:
That is an excellent excerpt from the Lecture Manual. Another supporting document below for Choice B.
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-NSX-T-Data-Center/3.0/administration/GUID-891363D9-D7D6-418B-9C81-33F2A42EA665.html

Deploy partner service VMs that run the partner security engine on all the NSX-T Data Center hosts in a cluster. After you deploy the SVMs, you can create policy rules used by SVM to protect guest VMs.

discussion.content:
B should be the correct answer.

"For SVMs deployed on compute hosts, an SVM does not need to be installed on every host. Some customers prefer to deploy the partner SVM on each host to achieve the least amount of traffic hairpinning.
When the partner SVM is deployed in a service cluster, traffic is sent from the compute hosts across the overlay to the hosts in the service cluster."

Taken from NSX-T ICM 3.0 Lecture Manual
B is correct answer

Selected Answer: B
is B is Good

Selected Answer: B
B is correct answer
B is correct, just as it's done in NSX-V
B should be correct

questions.question_text: When deploying east-west network introspection, which Service Virtual Machine (SVM) deployment method achieves the least amount of traffic hairpinning?

discussion.content: A&B are correct. Large size Edge Node has more compute resource
I think is B & D. Increasing the node size allow to manage a bigger deployment but'c directly address the speed towards upstreaming routers
A and B correct

Selected Answer: AB
AB is correct

Deffo B 
Equal cost multi-path (ECMP) routing protocol increases the north and south communication bandwidth by adding an uplink to the tier-0 ...

B is certain.
D is only valid for baremetal Edge, so A is more correct.

choices.D: Add an additional vNIC to the NSX Edge node.
choices.B: Configure ECMP on the Tier-0 gateway.
choices.C: Configure NAT on the Tier-0 gateway.
choices.E: Configure a Tier-1 gateway and connect it directly to the physical routers.

questions.question_text:
In a NSX-T Data Center environment, an administrator is observing low throughput and congestion between the Tier-0 Gateway and the upstream physical routers.
Which two actions could address low throughput and congestion? (Choose two.)
Which three steps must be carried out to configure North-South / East-West Network Inspection? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
The correct answer should be ACD.

Use these steps to configure north-south and east-west Network Introspection:
1. Service Registration: Service registration makes a service available in the catalog.
2. Service Deployment: Deploy an instance of a registered service.
3. Service Consumption: Use services in a service chain and redirect traffic.

Taken from NSX-T ICM 3.0 Lecture Manual.
ACD NSX-T ICM 3.0 course

A,C,and D
From https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-NSX-T-Data-Center/3.2/nsxt_32_admin.pdf; Section: Network Introspection Settings; page 447: "All service-insertion related configuration such as partner service registration, deployment and consumption, is done from a Local Manager (LM).

So yeah, Service Insertion IS Network Introspection. I think the question likely is "...configure North-South / East-West network Introspection?" (not inspection)

Selected Answer: ACD
ACD
Configuration of Network Introspection for both east-west and north-south includes the following steps:
1. Service registration 2. Service deployment 3. Service consumption:

Selected Answer: ACD
ACD is correct as best summarised by my Homie Diegof1

1. Service registration 2. Service deployment 3. Service consumption:
